bibl.title: The Undertakers of the Great Oasis (P. Nekr.)
bibl.seg: Roger S. Bagnall, The Undertakers of the Great Oasis (P. Nekr.) = Graeco-Roman Memoirs. Supplementary Volume No. 1.
London, Egypt Exploration Society, 2017, xiv-148 pp., figg. ISBN 978-0-85698-234-7. Â£85.

P. Nekr. 1-48. - The volume presents a group of papyri, discovered in the 1890s and partially published by Grenfell and Hunt in 1897 (P. Grenf. II). They come from the Khargha Oasis and date to the period 237 to 314. Many of them relate to a family of 'nekrotaphoi' - 'undertakers', an activity which also included responsibility for the mummification process (rather than just grave-digging). The texts contain petitions, letters and private legal instruments (such as loans, mandates, deeds of gift or sales). - Preface. - Introduction: 1. The archive; - 2. The people; - 3. The terminology of the nekrotaphoi; - 4. The nekrotaphoi and their status; - 5. Places. - Texts. - Indexes. Concordances.
